definitions.definition: having a desire to cause physical or mental pain and make somebody suffer

examples.text: He was known to be a cruel dictator.
I can't stand people who are cruel to animals.
Her eyes were cruel and hard.
Sometimes you have to **be cruel to be kind** *(= make somebody suffer because it will be good for them later)*.

definitions.definition: causing physical or mental pain and making somebody suffer

examples.text: It was a **cruel irony** that he, being gravely ill, would survive his family.
It would be a **cruel twist of fate** if he escaped only to starve to death once outside.
Her father's death was a **cruel blow**.

definitions.definition: a category of very severe punishment that is banned under US law

examples.text: This important case confronts the issue of what constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.
Detainees are subjected to malnutrition, forced labor, and to other cruel and unusual punishments.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin crudelis, related to crudus ‘raw, rough’.
